alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 2:49PM MST until July 14 at 4:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR AREAS NEAR COTTONWOOD... At 245 PM MST, the public reported flooding along Camino Real and Old Highway 279. This road has been barricaded! Between 1 and 2.75 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 inch in 1 hour. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Clarkdale, Cottonwood, Verde Village, Bridgeport, Cherry, Jerome, Mingus Mountain Campground, Dead Horse Ranch State Park, Playground Group Campground, Powell Springs Campground, Tuzigoot National Monument and Potato Patch Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 89A between mile markers 333 and 357. State Route 260 between mile markers 207 and 215. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Oak Wash, Ash Creek, Verde River, Cienega Creek, Oak Creek, Racetrack Wash, Blowout Creek, Cherry Creek, Coyote Spring and Bitter Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Normally dry washes will also flood! Do not attempt to cross flooded or closed roads! Find an alternate route.
